block.p: Tara Clare James, a daughter of Ann and John James of Glen Rock, N.J., was married yesterday in Fairfield, Conn., to Benjamin Robert Gibb, the son of Marilyn Clark Gibb of Atlanta and Robert Gibb of Colorado Springs. The Rev. George Sankoorikal performed the ceremony at St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church, with Francis Flood, an uncle of the bride and a Catholic deacon, taking part.

Mrs. Gibb, 27, is the marketing services manager at Mac Publishing, a San Francisco company that publishes the Macworld computer magazine and operates several Web sites. She graduated cum laude from the University of Richmond. Her mother is a news assistant at The New York Times. Her father, a retired sales representative, worked in Wayne, N.J., for ADT, a manufacturer of fire and burglar alarms.

Tara Clare James, a daughter of Ann and John James of Glen Rock, N.J., was married yesterday in Fairfield, Conn., to Benjamin Robert Gibb, the son of Marilyn Clark Gibb of Atlanta and Robert Gibb of Colorado Springs. The Rev. George Sankoorikal performed the ceremony at St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church, with Francis Flood, an uncle of the bride and a Catholic deacon, taking part.

Mrs. Gibb, 27, is the marketing services manager at Mac Publishing, a San Francisco company that publishes the Macworld computer magazine and operates several Web sites. She graduated cum laude from the University of Richmond. Her mother is a news assistant at The New York Times. Her father, a retired sales representative, worked in Wayne, N.J., for ADT, a manufacturer of fire and burglar alarms.

Mr. Gibb, 29, is an account executive at ABD Inc., an insurance brokerage firm in Belmont, Calif. He graduated from the University of Georgia. His mother is a manager at Erika Reade, an antiques and gift store in Atlanta. His father retired as a sales manager in Tampa, Fla., for the International Paper Company. The bridegroom is the stepson of Marilyn A. Gibb.
